channel.title: Grand Theft Auto 3, Vice City, San Andreas etc
channel.description: I was just wondering if anybody had a copy of one of these games on steam that they could gift to me. I have the newest one, but I prefer the feel of the older games more. Just don't gift me GTA 4, if you can then PM me please thanks in advance :stuck_out_tongue:

item.title: Grand Theft Auto 3, Vice City, San Andreas etc
item.dc:creator: Jingles
item.description:
I know, but those are the only forums, like I said, I ahve the game now, can we just put it behind us and start over?

Read full topic

item.title: Grand Theft Auto 3, Vice City, San Andreas etc
item.dc:creator: Door
item.description:
Jingles:

I was mainly referring to level’s comments and the people who were rude for no reason, there wasn’t really any reason to be rude, he just did it because he could.

There was reason to be rude; you are not in true need, the people here hardly know you and you plastered this over several forums.

Read full topic
item.source: Grand Theft Auto 3, Vice City, San Andreas etc

item.title: Grand Theft Auto 3, Vice City, San Andreas etc
item.dc:creator: Jingles
item.description:
Jambo:

I’ve been pretty laid back and relaxed over the past few months on these forums, but get the fuck out of here.

I mean really, you come in here and ask for free games, and when people say no or question you, they aren’t decent? What the fucking fuck? I’ve gifted a ton of games to people on these forums via steam. But it’s always been from me offering first, or them indirectly mentioning they don’t have it or would like it. In those cases it’s ok, but just fucking asking and then getting all high and mighty when people question you? Fuck!

I was mainly referring to level’s comments and the people who were rude for no reason, there wasn’t really any reason to be rude, he just did it because he could.

Who the hell do you think you are?

You are an unknown on a forum, been here less then 3 months, and thinking people care enough about you to give you games over steam just because you ask nicely.

You’re an idiot.

And I was not getting all “high and mighty” when someone questioned me and I did not expect anyone to give me a copy, anyway, as I said, I have a copy of the game now, can’t we just leave it at that now?

Read full topic
item.source: Grand Theft Auto 3, Vice City, San Andreas etc

item.source: Grand Theft Auto 3, Vice City, San Andreas etc

item.title: Grand Theft Auto 3, Vice City, San Andreas etc
item.dc:creator: Charli
item.description:
oh, good ol’ times…

Vice City is still one of my favorite games, I even used to mod a bit :3
I made cross-hairs in Paint , some guys even downloaded them oO and also a stunt video ^^ mmh, those actually might still be up at gta-action.com :fffuuu:

San Andreas was nice too, but somehow I kinda didn’t like it that much…
Would love to play GTA IV but I heard the PC port isn’t too good? like high hardware requirements and stuff… any experiences?
and too bad I missed that Christmas sale

and don’t forget about the original GTA and GTA 2! I still like to play them every now and then :3

btw, some GTA related Mods I follow:

  • Duke Theft Auto actually an independent title and not a mod. It’s a remake of the original game
  • Back to the Future: Hill Valley A Vice City mod dedicated to the Back to the Future series, looks quite decent imho :3

Anymore GTA related mods or other stuff out there you enjoyed?

Read full topic
item.source: Grand Theft Auto 3, Vice City, San Andreas etc

item.title: Grand Theft Auto 3, Vice City, San Andreas etc
item.dc:creator: ShadowNate
item.description:
Dust:

San Andreas has a Version 3. Basically the downloadable version.

For some reason, the developers disabled the ability to mod on this one (except for a few graphic mods)

I was playing the multi-theft-auto mod, a few months ago, with the steam version of Gta San Andreas. If I can remember right, I had to use a special executable (older version or sth) which I copied in the games folder with a slightly different name from the official steam executable.

Read full topic
